author: Lesley Waters
method: For the fondue, pour the cider into a pan and cook over a high heat until reduced by a third. Stir in the Stilton, whisking until completely melted.  In a small bowl, mix the cornflour with the cold water into a paste and stir into the cider and Stilton mixture. Stir in the fresh chives just before serving.  For the croûtes, drizzle the bread chunks with the oil and fry in a pan for 4-5 minutes, or until golden-brown and crisp. To serve, transfer the fondue to a large serving bowl set on a large plate, arranging the croûtes around the edges of the plate.
ingredients: 200ml/7fl oz cider,  150g/5½oz Stilton cheese, chopped,  2 tsp cornflour,  1 tsp cold water,  1 tbsp chopped fresh chives,  1 slice thick white bread, cut into large chunks,  3 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
